poem:
**Brittle Beginnings**

A morning shatters,  
tinted glass of hope  
fractured by steam,  
love's warmth turned hazard.

Hands once cradled  
comfort are cautioned;  
fragile handles,  
fragile hearts.

On the radio,  
warnings ripple,  
echoing through kitchen walls—  
hot liquid can break anything.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "580,000 glass coffee mugs recalled due to US warning they could shatter with hot liquid More than half a million glass coffee mugs are being recalled across the US after a government warning that they could shatter on contact with hot liquid and cause serious injuries. “Consumers should immediately stop using the recalled coffee glasses,” the Consumer Product Safety Commission said in a statement. The mugs are Declan single-wall glass coffee mugs and the recall". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
